Class FileHandler

    Created by Andre on 18.04.2017.

      java.lang.String readFileReturnString(java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader)

    • Method Detail

      • readURLFile

        public java.lang.String readURLFile(java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method uses readFileReturnString to return a string of a URL file. Method is made to seperate URL reading from OpenFile reading.
        Parameters:
        bufferedReader - Takes a bufferedReader to read a file.
        Returns:
        Returns a String of the read file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws the exception.

      • readOpenFile

        public java.lang.String readOpenFile(java.io.File RLEFile)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method takes a file and throws it into the readFileReturnString method and returns the String. Methods are separated to be more lucid, and to be used by other methods.
        Parameters:
        RLEFile - Takes a file, converts it to a String.
        Returns:
        Return the String of the read file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws any Exceptions, handled in Controller/PatternController.

      • readFileReturnString

        public java.lang.String readFileReturnString(java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method takes a BufferedReader as parameter which is used to read a file and return a StringBuilder. It checks if there is any signs/letters that is used in the GameOfLife RLE format. If the methods finds a number, it multiplies that number with the next sign. 3o = ooo 2b = bb etc. Method used by readURLFile and readOpenFile.
        Parameters:
        bufferedReader - Uses a bufferedReader to read a file.
        Returns:
        Returns a String which is basically a StringBuilder.toString().
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws any exceptions.

      • readStringToBoard

        public void readStringToBoard(java.lang.String RLEText,
                              DynamicGameBoard dynamicGameBoard)
        This method is used to set new values of the current cellArrayList. It reads a String and creates a pattern in the main cellArrayList. Starts with offsetY and offsetX to start setting the pattern in the center of the screen.
        Parameters:
        RLEText - String is read and creates new boolean state values in the cellArrayList.
        dynamicGameBoard - Uses the used DynamicGameBoard.
